    • Method Detail

      • sampleMultiplicative

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.Double> sampleMultiplicative(double lowerBound,
                                                                    double upperBound,
                                                                    int numberOfSamples)
        Samples multiplicative evenly distributed between the lower bound and upper bound. E.g. Sampler.sampleMultiplicative(1, 10, 10) results in values from 1.0 to 10.0 with step width of 1.
        Parameters:
        lowerBound - The minimal sample.
        upperBound - The maximal sample.
        numberOfSamples - The number of total samples.
        Returns:
        The samples.

      • sampleLogarithmic

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.Double> sampleLogarithmic(double lowerBound,
                                                                 double upperBound,
                                                                 double sharpness,
                                                                 int numberOfSamples)
        Samples logarithmic evenly distributed values between the lower and upper bound. The sharpness determines the distribution towards the lower bound (values larger than 1) or upper bound (smaller than 1).
        Parameters:
        lowerBound - The minimal sample.
        upperBound - The maximal sample.
        sharpness - The sharpness determines the distribution towards the lower bound (values larger than 1) or upper bound (smaller than 1).
        numberOfSamples - The number of total samples.
        Returns:
        The samples

      • sampleExponentially

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.Double> sampleExponentially(int smallestExponent,
                                                                   int largestExponent,
                                                                   double baseMultiplier)
        Returns exponentially evenly distributed values with base 10. E.g. Sampler.sampleExponentially(-4, 2, 1) returns values from 1e-4, 1e-3, ... 1e1, 1e2
        Parameters:
        smallestExponent - The smallest exponent.
        largestExponent - The largest exponent.
        baseMultiplier - The value the exponent is multiplied with.
        Returns:
        The samples.
